chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Barry D Hoffmann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Barry D Hoffmann is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Barry D Hoffmann was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Barry D Hoffmann was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Barry D Hoffmann was found guilty of Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Barry D Hoffmann was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Cts 3,4,6,7:  Balance of fine/costs ($2000.00 bail applied) due by payment plan of $200 per month beginning 2/27/15 during probation period.
  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
Defendant to participate in drug and/or alcohol counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by DOC and to pay all costs of treatment
Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription. All prescriptions to remain in original containers.

timeConds.notes: Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08

miscConds.notes:
(Read-In 13CM230) Restitution to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections.  And collected by Dept. of Corrections within first 30 days of supervision. 
*10-27-15 Restitution amount determined to be $50.00
Upon notification to the court of the amount due, an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution.  Further, an additional Administrative Surcharge equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines  will be assessed.  Amended Judgment of Conviction will follow.

Defendant Barry D Hoffmann in court with attorney Meg C. O'Marro-Felli.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionaire filed. Case to be recalled for clarification of offer.
9:48am Case recalled, same appearances. State gives recommendation. Court examines defendant, accepts change of plea and finds defendant guilty. Court renders a withheld sentence; Count 3: 3 years probation; 6 months condition time and other conditions. Count 4: 30 days condition time consecutive to Count 3. Defendant remanded into custody. Jury trial dates for both cases (13CM230) removed from court calendar.
